column1: Rosolini (Sicilian: Rusalini) is a comune (municipality) in the Province of Syracuse

column2: southern Italy.  It is about 200 kilometres (120 mi) southeast of Palermo and about 40 kilometres (25 mi) southwest of Syracuse. Rosolini was a town in feudal times
column3: and was a settlement in the late Imperial Roman and Byzantine Ages. In the 15th century
column4: Rosolini was a fief of the Platamones. It was the Moncadas
column6: which founded the newer town of Rosolini which we see today.

column1: Rosolini borders the following municipalities: Ispica
